Subject: support GCC 3.4 in Ken Stanley C++ NEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=160585998; y=-3CVOnYZhTeA2edxJHb8aFNd_MRi9tp2eeJvL0udV-IBC81pUC0
X-Yahoo-Profile: phmcquesten

I have posted two files to support GCC version 3.4 in Ken's C++ NEAT. 
Use some caution, because I started from the tar file at 
http://nn.cs.utexas.edu. OTOH, if it compiles it is probably not 
broken, right? (!! YMMV)

WARNING: This mod supports neither SWIG/GUILE nor GTKMM/VISUAL.
In fact, I hacked around them rather blindly.

The first file is kstanleyGCC34diff.txt, being a patch diff for the 
source. (Windows users can probably read it well enough to see what is 
going on.) The main issues were "using namespace std;" and non-suffixed 
header files. Strstream disappeared, but the StringStream replacement 
is almost drop-in. Tried to eliminate unused and uninitialized variable 
warnings. Missing return values fixed, because they can be real 
problems. (Unless they were all guile-support?)

The second file is a replacement Makefile, which you are at liberty to 
ignore if you please. It alleges support for GUILE and GTKMM, but that 
has not been tested whatsoever. For the Windows platform, I recommend 
MSYS/MinGW or CYGWIN.

Let me know if you have problems, but do be aware that I have barely 
tested it at all.

Is this kind of stuff worth posting here, or should there be a 
Sourceforge repository?
